task_text: Find me the least skilled person in German language (pick the one with more project work, if multiple match)

text_blocks: I have 50 results, but I need to find employees with the LOWEST German skill level. The results are sorted by highest level first. I need to search for employees with the minimum skill level in German. Let me search for employees with skill_german at low levels to find the minimum.
No employees with German level 1. Let me check level 2.
I found employees with German level 2. Let me get all of them to identify the tiebreaker.

I have all 19 employees with German skill level 2 (the lowest). Now I need to find their project workload (sum of time_slice from all projects they're on). Let me use find_projects_by_employee for each of them to determine who has the most project work.

project.name: Hygienic tank lining series
project.description: Development of solventborne and waterborne tank linings for Mediterranean Bottling syrup and water tanks.

project.name: Pre-treatment interface for e-coat line
project.description: Coating system tuned for CentraleAuto's pre-treatment stage feeding an existing e-coat line.

project.name: Cleanroom-compatible coating package
project.description: Coating package for Helvetic FoodTech equipment and adjacent cleanroom surfaces.

project.name: Fire-protection topcoat certification
project.description: Certification and testing programme for Iberia Construction fire-protection topcoat systems.

project.name: Hygienic flooring for processing area
project.description: Floor system for food & beverage processing lines with hygienic, washable finish.

project.name: Fast-cure floor system for cold warehouses
project.description: Fast-curing industrial floor system for cold and ambient warehouses applied by Benelux Floor Solutions.

project.name: Hygienic flooring for processing area
project.description: Floor system for food & beverage processing lines with hygienic, washable finish.

project.name: Depot steel refurbishment system
project.description: Coating system for steel structures in AlpineRail depot halls and maintenance pits.

project.name: HR – skills & wills data cleanup
project.description: Internal project to clean up and harmonise skills and wills data across the employee registry.

Now I have all the data. The tiebreaker is "pick the one with more project work". Looking at the employees with German skill level 2 (the minimum):

- **Giorgio Pellegrini (ayEi_045)**: 2 projects, 0.9 FTE
- **Roberto Caruso (ayEi_046)**: 2 projects, 0.9 FTE

Both have the same number of projects (2) AND the same total FTE (0.9). They are tied on both tiebreaker criteria! In this case, both have the lowest German skill with the most project work, tied equally.

Let me verify by checking if there's any distinction - perhaps I should report both or pick one arbitrarily. Since the tiebreaker rule says "pick the one with more project work, if multiple match" and both have exactly the same project count AND FTE, I should report both as tied winners.

input.message:
The least skilled employees in German language are **Giorgio Pellegrini** and **Roberto Caruso**, both with skill level 2 (the lowest in the system).

Applying the tiebreaker (most project work), both are tied:
- **Giorgio Pellegrini**: 2 projects, 0.9 FTE total
- **Roberto Caruso**: 2 projects, 0.9 FTE total

Since they have identical project counts and FTE allocation, they share the position as the least skilled in German with the most project work.
